intro: Dyschoriste longicalyx, commonly known as the long-leaved dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal within the ecosystem.
